data.description:
Click below to activate once you're ready to distribute the course URL to your class
[[Activation]] [[SaveAsTemplate]]

data.title: Folder
data.description: An organizational tool, which may contain other resources. Most often, an instructor would create a folder to hold related items, such as all links, assets, or files associated with a certain topic, project, or due date.

data.title: Document Collection
data.description:
A repository for useful files, typically those employed in the delivery of course information or material that offers educational support. The collection may be organized, referenced, or assigned by instructors for students to access

Typical Uses
• A location to host course information, policies, or processes.
• A location to host documents related to activities or labs, articles, or worksheets to be used in class.

data.title: HTML Page
data.description:
A flexible blank slate on which an instructor can incorporate any HTML-based content. The page HTML page can incorporate links, images, or active multimedia content. HTML pages within the Portal can be produced through an easy-touse editor.

Typical Uses
• General content such as announcements, policies, explanations

data.title: Quiz
data.description:
An assignment primarily designed to assess knowledge. Quizzes replicate the experience of traditional in-class quizzes, in that they are often timed and do not incorporate support opportunities.

Typical Uses
• Reading verification
• Summative Assessment

data.title: Writing Assignment
data.description:
An assignment in which the student will submit and receive credit for a written response, usually of a significant length. Student responses are not automatically graded, but are held in an instructor-accessible repository where the instructor can read, review, grade and ?comment? when convenient.

Typical Uses
• Assigning essays or other lengthy written responses.
Assign and customize you book's contents.
To add related content, drag any content item to the table of contents and drop it where you want it.
